greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1-phi(x^3)^3/phi(x))/2 where phi() is a Ramanujan theta function.
comment: Ramanujan theta functions: f(q) := Prod_{k>=1} (1-(-q)^k) (see A121373), phi(q) := theta_3(q) := Sum_{k=-oo..oo} q^(k^2) (A000122), psi(q) := Sum_{k=0..oo} q^(k*(k+1)/2) (A010054), chi(q) := Prod_{k>=0} (1+q^(2k+1)) (A000700).
reference: B. C. Berndt, Ramanujan's Notebooks Part V, Springer-Verlag, see p. 375 Entry 35.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..1000
Michael Somos, Introduction to Ramanujan theta functions
Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Ramanujan Theta Functions
formula: a(n) is multiplicative and a(2^e) = (1-3(-1)^e)/2 if e>0, a(3^e) = 1, a(p^e) = e+1 if p == 1 (mod 6), a(p^e) = (1+(-1)^e)/2 if p == 5 (mod 6).
mathematica: a[n_]:= SeriesCoefficient[(1 - EllipticTheta[3, 0, q^3]^3/EllipticTheta[ 3, 0, q])/2, {q, 0, n}]; Table[a[n], {n, 0, 50}] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Dec 16 2017 *)
results.author: _Michael Somos_, Nov 10 2005
